body:
I deploy an environment with kubenet according to this guide:
http://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/network-plugins/

Then I create a deployment with host port mapping:
apiVersion: extensions/v1beta1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: nginx
spec:
  replicas: 2
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nginx
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        image: nginx
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
          hostPort: 80

Then I find that the 80 port in node is not hold by kubelet progress.

**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`):
$ kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"6+", GitVersion:"v1.6.0-alpha.0.182+13cc43af826a5d", GitCommit:"13cc43af826a5d2769543e91d13c93dd68c6f809", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2016-11-08T04:42:35Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"6+", GitVersion:"v1.6.0-alpha.0.477+d5014c3f216204-dirty", GitCommit:"d5014c3f216204c2a8464a5bdf543f408eee6f71", GitTreeState:"dirty", BuildDate:"2016-11-14T11:01:41Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}

**Environment**:
- **Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: ubuntu local machine
- **OS** (e.g. from /etc/os-release):  
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION="16.04.1 LTS (Xenial Xerus)"
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS"
VERSION_ID="16.04"
HOME_URL="http://www.ubuntu.com/"
SUPPORT_URL="http://help.ubuntu.com/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="http://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/"
VERSION_CODENAME=xenial
UBUNTU_CODENAME=xenial
- **Kernel** (e.g. `uname -a`):
Linux kubenet-01 4.4.0-47-generic #68-Ubuntu SMP Wed Oct 26 19:39:52 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

**What happened**:
The host port is not token by kubelet.

**What you expected to happen**:
The host port should be token by kubelet.
title: host port is not hold by kubelet when using kubenet
